metadata.Headline: Quebec brings hammer down on doctors by adopting special law to force deal
metadata.Author: Philip Authier
metadata.Blurb: The CAQ invoked closure to fast track Bill 2, which includes a new salary structure for physicians and imposes stiff penalties for pressure tactics.

metadata.Headline: Habs Mailbag: Jakub Dobes passing eye test as Canadiens' No. 1 goalie
metadata.Author: Stu Cowan
metadata.Blurb: His strong play is a big part of Habs' hot start as Samuel Montembeault's struggles continue in loss to Oilers.

metadata.Headline: Canadiens' Patrik Laine out 3-4 months after surgery for muscle injury
metadata.Author: Stu Cowan
metadata.Blurb: It seems unlikely the 27-year-old will remain with Montreal beyond this season after surgery in New York to repair a core muscle injury.

metadata.Headline: 'There is no big picture' for roadwork in Montreal
metadata.Author: Linda Gyulai
metadata.Blurb: How many times can one stretch of road be ripped up? A Gazette investigation looks at several streets where the answer is: too often.

metadata.Headline: Liberal Leader Pablo Rodriguez tells Quebec doctors: 'Please, don't leave'
metadata.Author: Philip Authier
metadata.Blurb: "Wait for a year, we're going to be there. We're going to sit down with you and negotiate," he said after the CAQ adopted a new law dictating doctor salaries.

article_texts: The CAQ invoked closure to fast track Bill 2, which includes a new salary structure for physicians and imposes stiff penalties for pressure tactics. QUEBEC — Unable to reach a negotiated deal over a new salary structure with doctors, the Coalition Avenir Québec government Friday played hardball,adopting legislation imposing an agreementon them that includes stiff penalties for any retaliatory pressure tactics. TROIS-RIVIÈRES — Quebec Liberal leader Pablo Rodriguez promised Saturday to scrap the Coalition Avenir Québec government’s new law dictating doctor salaries and implored physicians thinking of leaving Quebec to sit tight.
